org.j2free.http
Class QueuedHttpCallService

java.lang.Object
  org.j2free.http.QueuedHttpCallService
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpCallService
@ThreadSafe
public final class QueuedHttpCallService
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpCallService

QueuedExecutorService a thread-safe service with methods to execute http calls in priority order. Internally, uses a ThreadPoolExecutor that is configured to use a PriorityBlockingQueue to order tasks by priority. The HttpCallTask objects are executed in instances of HttpCallable.

Parameters:

socketTimeout - How long to wait for an operation

shutdown

public boolean shutdown(long timeout,
                        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Attempts to shutdown the service in an ordely fashion, allowing all queued tasks to finish executing but not accepting any new tasks.

Specified by:

Parameters:
